title.narrative: 1.1.1 CAPACITY SUPPORT FOR Early Child Development (ECD)

description.narrative: By end of 2016, the policy and system capacity of Early Child Development (ECD) stakeholders at national and sub-national levels to implement, monitor and evaluate a quality and accessible national Integrated Early Child Development (ECD) programme, with specific focus on most vulnerable girls and boys, is enhanced, which contributes to Child Health, Cross-Sectoral Early Childhood Development, Early Childhood Development, Health Systems Strengthening, Immunization, Infant And Young Child Feeding, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By end of 2016, benefits from improved integrated and inclusive social services through strengthened national and sub-national capacities for child development are increased

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end of 2016, the policy and system capacity of ECD stakeholders at national and sub-national levels to implement, monitor andevaluate a quality and accessible national Integrated ECD programme, with specific focus on most vulnerable girls and boys, isenhanced

description.narrative: UNICEF and the Ministry of Health worked closely to improve the health and development status of children through addressing the dimensions of enhancing evidence-based policy development, improving the quality of child health services and promoting the healthy behavioral change among adolescent and young people using communication for development approach. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2016
